answers.answer: I'm 34 weeks and I have found literally nothing that helps. My doctor told me to drink more water, eat less sodium, eat two bananas a day, raise them up - nothing helps. I've unfortunately just been dealing with it as well as I can :(
My ankles swell also if I'm on my feet to much. I was scared at first cuz I thought I had preeclampsia and I already have GD so I was like Why does this happen but it's normal I guess I'm 35 weeks

question: is it bad to have such swollen feet I littarely wake up with them and I'm not on my feet much I already drink a lot of water but they are always so swollen does this happen to anyone else and it being normal do I have something to worry about I'm currently 38 weeks
title: Swollen feet? Help please
